description: A giant traditional Japanese conical hat (kasa) specially crafted by Portgas D. Ace for Little Oars Jr. to provide shelter from the sun, rain, and snow. Ace learned to make kasa in Wano Country and burned the first two attempts due to his Mera Mera no Mi fire powers before successfully creating this one on his third try.
creator: ace
significance: Symbolizes the deep friendship between Ace and Little Oars Jr., and serves as the motivation for Oars Jr.'s desperate charge to save Ace during the Battle of Marineford. The kasa represents themes of friendship, kindness, and sacrifice that are central to the episode.

keyMoments.description: Flashback reveals Ace crafting the giant kasa for Little Oars Jr. in Wano Country.
Oars Jr.'s kasa drops to the ground as he falls from Kuma's Ursus Shock. He sees it on the floor semi-conscious and remembers Ace's kindness.
